Package it.polimi.ingsw.client

Class TurnHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.TurnHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeListener, EventListener
public class TurnHandler extends Object implements PropertyChangeListener
Class TurnHandler is used to help the client when he is the current turn active player. The class suggest to the player which actions can be done in the turn and which actions must be done at the moment. ALso, TurnHandler will automatically end the turn of the client (by sending an EndTurn message to the sever) if the client have done all possible actions that he can do. The class implements the PropertyChangeListener interface because the TurnHandler will listen to some message handlers in order to know when it is the client turn and if the action made by the client have been acknowledged or not. The class uses a SingleThreadExecutor to perform the turn handling: the handlePlayerTurn method will be submitted to this executor when a new turn of the client starts.

    • handlePlayerTurn

      public void handlePlayerTurn(List<TurnPhase> possibleActions)
      Handles the client turn that can do all the specified possible actions. This method is done in parallel to the actual turn that the client sees from the UserInterface. The method will run until an EndTurn acknowledgement message arrives from the server. This is done with a producer - consumer pattern, where this method is the consumer part and the other on* methods are the producers part. Possible actions are updated every time a producer receives an acknowledgement.
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - the possible actions of the turn

    • onAckReceived

      public void onAckReceived(List<TurnPhase> newPossibleActions, String actionToAck)
      Handle the event of receiving an acknowledgement from the server.
      Parameters:
      newPossibleActions - the new actions that the clients can to do before ending the turn
      actionToAck - the action that was acknowledged

    • onErrorReceived

      public void onErrorReceived()

    • isTurnAlreadyEnded

      public boolean isTurnAlreadyEnded()
      Checks if the client have already sent an EndTurn message that was acknowledged by the server
      Returns:
      true if the client has ended his turn, otherwise false

    • setTurnAlreadyEnded

      public void setTurnAlreadyEnded(boolean turnAlreadyEnded)

    • isInputErrorReceived

      public boolean isInputErrorReceived()
      Checks if the last action of the client was blocked by the ActionInputParser because it was not correctly written.
      Returns:
      true if there was an error recognized by the ActionInputParser, otherwise false
